metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1601 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The KVM implementation in the Linux kernel before 3.3.6 allows host OS users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and host OS crash) by making a KVM_CREATE_IRQCHIP ioctl call after a virtual CPU already exists. A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's KVM (Kernel Virtual Machine) virtual cpu setup. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to crash the system leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1601` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

notes.Note: apw> sha1 below is from the KVM tree, though it is likely to be the right one when it hits upstream.  Patch title is: KVM: Ensure all vcpus are consistent with in-kernel irqchip settings now arrived in linus' tree as the sha1 below
